DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose of this study is to compare the efficacy of adapalene (DifferinÂ®) gel 0.3% and tretinoin 0.05% emollient cream for the treatment of signs of photodamage, with tolerability assessment as a secondary objective.
DOC.brief_title: Adapalene Gel 0.3% Versus Tretinoin 0.05% Emollient Cream for Treatment of Photodamage
DOC.criteria: Male or Female aged 40 years of age and older with Fitzpatrick skin types I through III Clinically moderate to severe photodamage Subjects with history of laser resurfacing, dermabrasion, medium or deep chemical peel of the face Subjects with diagnosis of skin cancer within 3 months of study entry Subjects who have had superficial chemical peels, exfoliation or microdermabrasion of the face within 3 months of study entry Subjects who have had botulinum toxin for facial rejuvenation within 6 months of study entry and are unwilling to refrain from botulinum toxin treatments during the study
